metadata.Title: CVE-2018-20845 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Division-by-zero vulnerabilities in the functions pi_next_pcrl, pi_next_cprl, and pi_next_rpcl in openmj2/pi.c in OpenJPEG through 2.3.0 allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service (application crash). It was discovered that OpenJPEG incorrectly handled certain image files. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2018-20845` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libopenjp2-7 - 2.3.1-1
libopenjp2-tools - 2.3.1-1
libopenjp3d-tools - 2.3.1-1
libopenjp3d7 - 2.3.1-1
libopenjpip-dec-server - 2.3.1-1
libopenjpip-server - 2.3.1-1
libopenjpip-viewer - 2.3.1-1
libopenjpip7 - 2.3.1-1
No subscription required

notes.Note: ebarretto> Marking emscripten ignored as openjpeg2 code is only for test/example. mdeslaur> Ubuntu openjpeg2 packages are built with BUILD_MJ2:BOOL=OFF, so the vulnerable code is not compiled

criterions.comment: blender package in impish is affected and may need fixing.
emscripten: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
insighttoolkit4 package in impish is affected and may need fixing.
openjpeg2 package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.3.1-1').
qtwebengine-opensource-src package in impish is affected and may need fixing.
texmaker package in impish is affected and may need fixing.
